item.name: BattleLore (Second Edition)
item.comment: I'd rather play a game of C&C: Ancients than this one but all things considered it's not *that* bad.

item.name: Concordia
item.comment: My second 10 on BGG. A fantastic clean, fast-paced and astonishing good game which pictures players as traders during the good ol' ancient roman empire. Do I need to add more?

item.name: Exit: The Game – The Abandoned Cabin
Five Tribes: I Geni di Naqala
item.comment:
IMHO one of the best 2p games ever made. This game deserves a 9,9 as a 2p game while it doesn't even reach a 6 if you play it as a 4p. Not only because of the inevitable analysis-paralysis that will leave you with enough time to smoke a joint in between players' turns but because you can't even try to plan ahead since the board state will change a lot before you'll play again.
As a 2p game it is a whole different game, which requires you to play tactically in order to adapt to your opponent's strategy while trying to force your own.

item.name: Fortune and Glory: The Cliffhanger Game
Isle of Skye: De Laird à Roi
item.originalname: Isle of Skye: From Chieftain to King

item.name: Oh My Goods!
item.comment:
Lot of luck in this tiny little game which will never leave my handbag. Plays fast, some interesting choices have to be made and when the tides change in your favour it is a pleasure to chain produce all the goods in the world.
Stay away if you don't like luck-based games tho.

item.name: Sid Meier's Civilization: The Board Game
Smash Up : Trop Minions
item.originalname: Smash Up: Pretty Pretty Smash Up

item.name: Sulle Tracce di Marco Polo
item.comment: My first 10 on BGG. An excellent game with an outstanding replay value. Multiple paths can lead to very high scores and it's only after 10 or so plays that you will understand this game's potential. Don't judge it based solely on your first play because the intricacies of this "chef d'oeuvre" will become clearer as you'll have more plays on your shoulders. This is definitely a must have.

item.name: The Voyages of Marco Polo: The New Characters
Yamataï
item.comment: Same puzzle as Five Tribes, only easier for newbies. Nothing really new but it deserves a place in my collection.
